RESOURCE.STRING: Fuel System Leakage Test
This is a manual test used to pressurize the fuel system which allows for operator assisted diagnostics.

This test requires that the vehicle not be moving and the engine to be running at idle conditions. This test will increase fuel rail pressure to the same level used at rated power. By increasing fuel rail pressure, certain types of fuel system leaks will be easier to find. External leaks and return flows from the injectors, rail pressure relief valve, and fuel pump can be checked with this test. Refer to the Troubleshooting and Repair Manual for this engine for specifications.
Name
Value
Units
Warning: This test operates the fuel system at a high fuel pressure. Wear safety glasses and stay clear from the engine when running this test.
Once the measurement is complete, turn off the engine and measure the amount of fluid in the graduated cylinder. Isolate one cylinder at a time and compare the test results between cylinders.
The test was aborted because the Vehicle Speed is greater than 0.
The test was aborted because the Engine Speed exceeded the test limit.
The test was unable to complete due to a fuel rail pressure exceeding the maximum threshold.
The test has been aborted for an unknown reason.
An unknown error has occurred.
The fuel system test has been stopped. The monitor parameters reflect the state of the engine at the time the test was stopped.
The test was not started because the Vehicle Speed was greater than 0.
The test was not started because the Engine Speed exceeded the test limit.
The test was not started because the Engine Speed was not greater than 600 rpm.
